resources.string: Персонаж вашего профиля в приложении будет скрыт.
Чтобы посмотреть персонаж профиля, нажмите \"Здоровье\" в приложении.
Help us improve our products and services by sharing your usage stats with us. We shall protect your personal information in accordance with our privacy policies.

"After you revoke the authorization, the account currently signed in on the device will be removed, and the related data previously stored on the server will be cleared. To delete data on your paired device, refer to Withdrawal of consent in our Privacy Policy. If you're using a wearable device, a factory reset erases all your data on it. If you change your mind, you won't be able to recover your data. You'll need to agree to our Privacy Policy again and pair your device if you decide you use it."

"After you withdraw your consent to our Privacy Policy, we will cease to collect your personal information. Your account will be signed out on your phone. The personal information already collected and retained will be deleted within the specific period in accordance with applicable laws and regulations unless required otherwise. To delete app data from your phone, remove this app from your phone, or clear app data in the Settings. 1. The account currently signed in on your paired device will be removed, and the related data previously stored on the server will be cleared. You can clear data stored on your paired device (e.g. sleep data, steps) with a factory reset. For further details, refer to Withdrawal of consent in our Privacy Policy. If you change your mind, you might not be able to recover the above data. To use your devices, you will need to pair with them again.
2. You'll lose all your data and content in Mi Fitness. You can no longer view your workout history and fitness data in the app. You can clear cached data for Mi Fitness and change the permissions that this app can access in Settings on your phone at any time.
If you change your mind, before using our services, you need to agree to our Privacy Policy and User Agreement.
The related data will be cleared within 15 days."

"After you withdraw your consent to our Privacy Policy, we will cease to collect your personal information. Your account will be signed out on your phone. The personal information already collected and retained will be deleted within the specific period in accordance with applicable laws and regulations unless required otherwise. To delete app data from your phone, remove this app from your phone, or clear app data in the Settings. 1. The account currently signed in on your paired device will be removed, and the related data previously stored on the server will be cleared. You can clear data stored on your paired device (e.g. sleep data, steps) with a factory reset. For further details, refer to Withdrawal of consent in our Privacy Policy. If you change your mind, you might not be able to recover the above data. To use your devices, you will need to pair with them again.
2. You'll lose all your data and content in Mi Fitness. You can no longer view your workout history and fitness data in the app. You can clear cached data for Mi Fitness and change the permissions that this app can access in Settings on your phone at any time.
If you change your mind, before using our services, you need to agree to our Privacy Policy and User Agreement."
Отзыв согласия с Политикой конфиденциальности и удаление данных
"Your workout and fitness data will be deleted permanently and you won't be able to restore it. Your account will be signed out on your phone. Continue?"

"1. Principles and Practice of Sleep Medicine，4th edition. 2. Fundamentals of Sleep Medicine. 3. Patel, A. K., Reddy, V., & Araujo, J. F. (2020, April). Physiology, Sleep Stages. StatPearls Publishing. 4. Taylor, P. (2020, May 30). Nap Time. Retrieved September 10, 2020, from https://www.pewsocialtrends.org/2009/07/29/nap-time/. 5. National Sleep Foundation's sleep time duration recommendations: methodology and results summary. Sleep health, 1(1), 40–43. 6. Exploring the nap paradox: are mid-day sleep bouts a friend or foe?. Sleep medicine, 37, 88–97. 7. National Sleep Foundation's sleep quality recommendations: first report. Sleep Health. 2017 Feb;3(1):6-19. 8. National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke. (n.d.). Brain basics: Understanding sleep. Retrieved June 7, 2017. 9. Management of Chronic Insomnia Disorder in Adults: A Clinical Practice Guideline From the American College of Physicians. Ann Intern Med. 2016 Jul 19;165(2):125-33."

"If you continue, you'll withdraw your consent to our Privacy Policy. The account currently signed in on your paired device will be removed. The related device data will be cleared within 7 days."

"Blood pressure is the pressure of blood pushing against the walls of your arteries as it's pumped around your body. It's written as two numbers: Systolic pressure, the upper number, the pressure in your arteries when your heart beats. Diastolic pressure, the lower number, the pressure in your arteries between beats."
Source: 2020 International Society of Hypertension Global Hypertension Practice Guidelines

Blood pressure is considered to be high when the value is 140 mmHg systolic and 90 mmHg diastolic or higher. Usually, 2 to 3 clinic visits at 1 to 4-week intervals are required to confirm the diagnosis.

"Based on office blood pressure measurements, blood pressure numbers of less than 130/85 mmHg are considered within the normal range. High-normal blood pressure is when readings consistently range from 130–139 systolic and less than 85–89 mmHg diastolic. Grade 1 hypertension is when blood pressure consistently ranges from 140–159 systolic or 90–99 mmHg diastolic. Grade 2 hypertension is when blood pressure consistently ranges at 160/100 mmHg or higher."

Body mass index (BMI) is defined as the body mass in kilograms divided by the square of the body height in meters. Knowing your BMI might help you understand whether your weight has any negative impact on your health.

Bone mineral is the inorganic component of bone tissue. The chemical composition of bones changes with age, affecting mineral density. Studies have shown that long-term regular resistance exercise can effectively delay bone deterioration, reduce fracture risk, and improve quality of life.
Body fat percentage refers to the proportion of fat in the total weight of the human body.

"Muscle percentage is calculated based on muscle mass, body weight, and height, etc. It's helpful for determining how healthy and strong you are. Regular exercise is essential for maintaining a healthy amount of muscle in your body."
Protein content refers to the proportion of protein in the total weight of the human body, which reflects how your diet affects your health.
Visceral fat is essential for stabilizing and protecting internal organs. However, high visceral fat increases the risk of cardiovascular and metabolic diseases.
Body water percentage refers to the proportion of water in the total weight of the human body. Usually, muscle tissue contains more water than other body parts.
"You won't be able to track your sleep data with your phone, including sleep cycles, snoring, and talking."
The start date should be earlier than the end date
Keeping a log of symptoms throughout cycles can help you identify patterns and understand what happens during cycles.
Based on the logged information about previous periods and cycle length, you can get predictions of future periods, fertile windows, and ovulation days.
The more you log, the more accurate predictions you get.
Energy is used in a variety of different ways, for example:
To get better results, keep wearing your device, especially to bed.

Your wearable device uses heart rate variability data to estimate your energy reserves, and help you determine when to get active or take a break. Stress and workouts can wear your energy down, while sleep and rest restore your energy.

"\"Standing\" shows hours in which you stood up and moved around for at least one minute.
To counteract sitting all day, stand and move during 12 or more hours of the day."

Training load is principally based on EPOC (Excess post-exercise oxygen consumption) measurements for the last 7 days, and is further scaled based on individual fitness level and longer-term training load.

"Your wearable device notifies you when your heart rate goes above a set level while you're inactive. Sometimes, it's normal for your heart rate to rise as a response to stress, caffeine intake, or a cold. However, people experiencing dizziness, shortness of breath, or palpitations should seek medical advice.
Note that the high heart rate data is not intended for medical purposes, nor is it intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease or condition."

"When you use your headphones, the app measures the ambient sound levels in your environment. Sounds are considered loud when they're over 60 decibels. Prolonged exposure to loud sounds can cause hearing damage. To protect your hearing during loud activities, consider wearing earplugs, using noise-canceling headphones, or moving away from loud sounds."
Prolonged exposure to very loud sounds can cause hearing damage. To protect your hearing, consider wearing earplugs, using noise-canceling headphones, or moving away from loud sounds.
"Looks like your current environment is noisy. If you're using headphones, use noise cancellation and keep the volume down."
Exposure to sounds below 60 dB should not cause hearing damage. They can help concentration.
"Stats are provided for your reference only. They can't be used as grounds for medical diagnosis."

"Hearing is the process by which the ear transforms sound vibrations in the external environment into nerve impulses that are conveyed to the brain where they are interpreted as sounds. When you use your headphones, the app measures your headphone audio exposure. Sounds over 60 decibels are considered loud, and over 80 decibels are considered very loud. Exposure to high levels of loudness can cause temporary or even permanent hearing loss. To protect your hearing during loud activities, consider wearing earplugs, using noise-canceling headphones, or moving away from loud sounds."
Check your network settings and try again

"Your wearable device notifies you when your heart rate goes above a set level while you're inactive. Sometimes, it's normal for your heart rate to rise as a response to stress, caffeine intake, or a cold. However, people experiencing dizziness, shortness of breath, or palpitations should seek medical advice.
Note that the high heart rate data is not intended for medical purposes, nor is it intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease or condition."

"Your wearable device notifies you when your heart rate goes below a set level while you're inactive. People experiencing dizziness, shortness of breath, or palpitations should seek medical advice.
Note that the low heart rate data is not intended for medical purposes, nor is it intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease or condition."
Sign in to sync your device
Every bit of info helps improve the accuracy of workout data.

"\"Moving\" shows your time doing moderate and vigorous activity. For adults aged 18–⁠64 years, aim for at least 30 minutes per day, 5 times per week of moderate activity. Alternatively, try 75 minutes a week of intense activity.
You'll see your \"Moving\" progress when your cadence exceeds 100 SPM or when your heart rate exceeds 65% of your max heart rate."
Earn PAI by doing any activity that gets your heart pumping.
Start with a goal of 30 PAI and work up to 100 in 7 days.
Every morning, the PAI you earned 7 days ago will expire. Stay active to keep your PAI score above 100.
The fitter you are, the more physical activity is needed to achieve 100 PAI.
Keeping your PAI score above 100 over a 7-day period can improve your cardiorespiratory fitness.
Turn on Continuous monitoring and set the frequency to 1 min
Run %1$s and keep your heart rate above %2$s
You can achieve a maximum of 75 PAI in one day.
Detect and record your activities with your phone
Go to Device page and tap Connect
Monitor your heart rate and track REM sleep
"It's normal to wake up few times during the night. Some may last a few seconds and are not usually remembered the next day. Typical range: Below 5%"

The rating is based on the monitoring of your night-time blood oxygen levels, indicating how well you breathe during sleep. Poor breathing at night may leave you fatigued and sleepy during the day. To breathe better at night, refer to the following tips.

"1. Sleep on your side. Side sleeping helps prevent your throat tissues and tongue from blocking your airway and reduce the effect of gravity on your airway. 2. Avoid evening alcohol. Alcohol relaxes throat muscles and increases the risk of airway obstruction. 3. Control weight if you're overweight. Weight loss can be effective to improve breathing at night. 4. Get physically active. Exercise strengthens your lungs and makes breathing easier."
"Reference range: 90–100 The rating is for information purposes only. If you feel unwell, seek medical help."

"During the second stage, your heart rate, breathing, and muscle tone continue to drop. Brain waves slow further. Eye movements remain absent. It's harder to wake you up at this point. Typical range: 20%–40%"

"Based on brain and body characteristics, sleep stages are categorized into light, deep, and rapid eye movement (REM) sleep. These stages cycle every 90 to 120 minutes, 4 to 6 times each night. Each cycle ends with brief awakenings. Note: It may seem unusual but you don't typically transition through these stages in sequence when you sleep."
"Couldn't save. Your sleep duration is longer than 24 hours."

"There's no set amount of time everyone needs to sleep since it varies with daily schedule, activity level, genetic makeup, and more. The National Sleep Foundation recommends healthy adults get 7 to 9 hours of sleep per night. Some people need as much as 10 hours of sleep while some thrive on as little as 6 hours."
"Looks like your current environment is noisy. If you're using headphones, use noise cancellation and keep the volume down."
"During the first stage of sleep, your heart rate and breathing slow, muscles relax, brain waves slow, and eye movements stop. You can be awakened easily at this stage. Typical range: 20%–60%"
"Napping can improve mood and memory. You might consider a nap to make up your sleep debt. But it isn't for everyone. People who have trouble falling asleep at night may want to avoid napping."
To get the most out of a nap, aim to nap for 10 to 20 minutes. Napping for too long may leave you feeling groggy.

"This phase involves irregular heart rate and breathing. Your brain races, eyes dart around, while your body is temporarily paralyzed. There's a good chance you can recall the dreams when you wake up from REM sleep. Typical range: 10%–30%"
Turn on to keep 100 MB of the latest recordings on your phone and delete older ones automatically to save storage space

"1. Avoid caffeine, alcohol, and heavy meals late in the day. 2. Be active, but avoid vigorous exercise before sleep. 3. Relax and wind down. Set aside your worries and stop mentally challenging tasks before bedtime. 4. Keep your bedroom dark. Exposure to light suppresses the secretion of melatonin, a hormone that initiates sleep. 5. Stick to a sleep schedule."
The National Sleep Foundation recommends healthy adults get 7 to 9 hours of sleep per night.
Record your sleep based on your phone usage, activity stats, as well as fall asleep and wake up time you set.
A sleep record already exists in this time period. Delete the previous record?
Turn off detection of snoring and talking?
Your blood oxygen level represents the percentage of oxygen in your blood. It can be a useful indicator of how well your circulatory system works.
Have you stood up within the last hour?

"The evaluation of your current stress level is based on your heart-rate variability (HRV), the time between your heartbeats, as well as your physical activities. Levels: Relaxed: 1–25 Mild: 25–50 Moderate: 51–80 Severe: 81–100."

"1. Your wearable device measures your stress level when you're inactive. 2. You might get blank areas, representing the time periods unable to determine stress due to too many actions. 3. If you couldn't get stress data on your wearable device, wear it to bed and check it again the next morning."
Stress is a feeling of being under pressure. A healthy amount of stress can help you focus and improve performance, but prolonged stress can result in tiredness and irritability.
Connect to WeChat and Alipay and share steps between apps
Sync workouts and fitness data across devices
Turn on Sync with the cloud to back up your workout and fitness data from your phone, and sync data from other devices. When the feature is on, you can also do the following.
"Looks like there's health data associated with your Mi Account (%1$s). To restore health data, turn on Sync with the cloud. When it's on, you can also:"
You can start a workout on your phone and track your Moving progress
Adults aged 18–⁠64 years should aim for at least 30 minutes per day, 5 times per week of moderate activity.
Walking 10000 steps a day can improve your health.
Apart from Steps and Calories, choose another goal.
"Your wearable device doesn't count %s. Set another goal?"
Start a workout, move around, and track progress towards your goals.

"\"Moving\" shows your time doing moderate and vigorous activity. For adults aged 18–⁠64 years, aim for at least 30 minutes per day, 5 times per week of moderate activity. Alternatively, try 75 minutes a week of intense activity. You'll see your \"Moving\" progress when your cadence exceeds 100 SPM or when your heart rate exceeds 65% of your max heart rate."
Note: The feature works with selected smart devices made by Xiaomi.
\"Calories\" shows the number of active calories you burn each day through moving around and exercising. Set the goal based on your weight management plan and calorie consumption.
\"Standing\" shows hours in which you stand up and move around. To counteract sitting all day, stand and move during 12 different hours in the day.

Track your steps, find out a baseline, set a goal, and work toward it one step at a time. Less than 5000 steps per day may indicate sedentary lifestyle. An active person walks between 8000 and 10000 steps a day.
Track daily goals with your phone and wearable device
The average person burns about 200–300 kcal during 30 minutes of running.
To avoid being sedentary, stand up and move around during 12 different hours in the day.

VO₂ max represents the max volume of oxygen uptake measured during incremental exercise at maximal effort. It’s an indicator of aerobic endurance and capacity. Generally, a high VO₂ max value means you are able to exercise at a higher intensity than those who are not as well conditioned.
Your end time should not before your start time.
For obtaining the frequency of light changes around the finger through the camera in order to determine the heart rate value
What state are you in right now?
"Fully cover the camera with your finger. Wait until the circle turns red."
"During the measurement, place your finger on the camera. Your phone's flash shines a light on your finger and the camera detects color changes in your finger each time your heart beats."

"You can measure your heart rate just by covering your phone's flash and camera with a finger. The flash will be used as a continuous light source, and the camera will detect changes in the blood flow. The images will then be analyzed, and your heart rate will be determined based on the repeated patterns."

"Take multiple measurements to make sure your current reading is accurate. The results provided here are for your reference only. This measurement method can't substitute professional medical equipment."
"You're completely relaxed or have just woken up."
"Can't measure heart rate while using Split screen"
To be able to track changes in blood flow and measure your heart rate, allow this app to access fingerprint scanner.

Blood flows to your fingers with every heartbeat. Bright light in the fingerprint scanner area under the screen allows us to track the changes in your blood flow, analyze the patterns, and convert them into heart rate values.

"Blood isn't completely opaque; therefore, light can pass through it. With every heartbeat, blood flows to your fingers, blocking more light than between the heartbeats. Bright light in the fingerprint scanner area under the screen allows us to track the changes in your blood flow, analyze the patterns, and convert them into heart rate values."

"Note: Make sure your finger fully covers the fingerprint icon during the measurement. Don't apply force, as it might block blood flow in your fingertip and make the results inaccurate. This measurement is provided for your reference only. It can't replace medical tests."
Our tests show that this method measures your heart rate with an error of only ≤3 BPM.
Cover the icon with your finger
Normal heart rate ranges from 60 to 100 beats per minute. A heart rate lower than 60 BPM is a sign of bradycardia, while a heart rate over 100 BPM is accepted as tachycardia in adults.
"To be able to measure heart rate, allow this app to access your phone's camera."
Fully cover flash and camera with one finger

Measuring your heart rate immediately after working out can help you adjust your exercising habits, as workouts of different intensity have different optimal heart rate zones. If your heart rate is too high, the activity might be detrimental to your health, leading to dizziness, chest tightness, and other risks. Low heart rate might be a sign of low effectiveness of a particular workout.
"Your heart rate tells us that you're engaging in physical activity of relatively high intensity. Your heart and lungs are working hard."
"Your heart rate tells us that you're engaging in physical activity of high intensity. Your heart and lungs are working hard. Pay attention to your state and stop exercising if you feel unwell."

"Your heart rate tells us that you're engaging in physical activity of relatively low intensity. It's suitable for warming up and doing simple exercises. People with various health conditions are recommended to do exercises of low to moderate intensity."
"Your heart rate tells us that you're engaging in physical activity of low intensity. It stimulates your body to a certain extent without requiring much energy."

"Your heart rate tells us that you're engaging in physical activity of moderate intensity. It's recommended that most healthy adults engage in moderate to high-intensity exercise for a total of 150 minutes per week."

Normal heart rate is maintained by the human body during daily activities, and ranges from 60 to 100 beats per minute. A heart rate lower than 60 BPM is a sign of bradycardia, while a heart rate over 100 BPM is accepted as tachycardia in adults.

Your current heart rate is too fast. Excessive physical activity, drinking alcohol, heavy physical labor, nervousness, anxiety, or taking certain drugs may cause physiological tachycardia. Additionally, cardiovascular diseases, anemia, hyperthyroidism, hypoxia, heart failure, and other diseases might be the signs of pathological tachycardia. If you feel unwell, please consult your physician in time.

"Your current heart rate is normal. Your heart can cope with stress well, and your body can resist external pressure. However, you shouldn't forget that heart rate changes might be the signs of heart disease. Always keep an eye on your heart rate, especially during exercise."

"Your current heart rate is too slow. About 15% of people can experience physiological bradycardia, which is a slow sinus rhythm lower than 60 BPM. If this condition doesn't cause dizziness, blackouts, vertigo, or fainting, you likely won't need any treatment. However, if you experience chest tightness or other symptoms, please consult your physician in time."

Your resting heart rate is faster than normal which might be the sign of tachycardia. A low-salt and oil-reduced diet, weight loss, quitting smoking and alcohol, mental health awareness, and physical activity might help you to slow down your resting heart rate.

"Your resting heart rate is normal. Resting heart rate is the number of times your heart beats per minute when you're at rest. The best time to measure your resting heart rate is when you wake up in the morning, while still lying in bed and not doing any physical activity. Take some time to breathe deeply before measuring your resting heart rate to completely relax your body."

Your resting heart rate is slower than normal which might be the sign of bradycardia. Extended periods of slow heartbeat may cause ischemia and hypoxia, as well as other cardiovascular and cerebrovascular disorders. Resting heart rate is closely related to your diet, activity, stress levels, sleep habits, and overall physical condition. Maintain a healthy lifestyle and pay attention to your body in order to avoid problems. If you experience chest tightness, dizziness, blackouts, vertigo, or fainting, please consult your physician in time.

"Resting heart rate is the number of times your heart beats per minute when you're at rest. Typically, a resting heart rate ranges from 55 to 80 BPM. However, it varies with age, gender, and other factors."
"We'll use this email to verify your account"
Не можете найти мед. паспорт на экране блокировки?
This feature requires signing in to Mi Account. Sign in now?
For obtaining blood flow changes for heart rate detection
Check your network settings and try again
A system error occurred. Try again later.
You can remove or add the character in Profile > Settings.

string.name: login_internal_test_agreement
string.Data: 如您确认参与，请查看并点击同意《小米运动健康内测协议》

resources.string:
"本内测软件尚处于开发测试过程中，仅为验证功能效果及测试稳定性释放给部分用户，所有内容应作为机密对待，在使用过程中请注意：
1.1 App稳定程度低于线上版本，可能存在功能不稳定或无法正常使用、数据丢失的情况，请谨慎参与测试。
1.2 请使用与内测报名时相同的小米帐号登录App，否则将导致数据异常并无法参与测试礼品领取。
1.3 本着自愿原则，您可随时退出本次内测，删除本内测软件，重新下载原有正式版本软件进行使用。
1.4 当前版本仅支持设备下列的联动使用，更多设备将逐步开放支持：
· 小米手环5、6标准版和NFC版 · Redmi手环 · 小米手表Color、小米手表Color运动版、Xiaomi Watch Color2 · Redmi手表、Redmi手表2 · Xiaomi Watch S1 · 米家跑步机"
您当前登录的小米账号不具备测试资格
请同意内测协议后继续

Welcome to Mi Fitness. You can use this app to manage your devices, track your workouts, and view fitness data. We shall protect your personal information in accordance with the relevant laws, regulations, and privacy policies.

"1. It takes about 3 working days for the refund to be returned to the payment method used to make the original purchase. You can always check the refund status in Profile > Cards > Settings. 2. If your refund does not arrive, try the following steps: (1) Open Shenzhen Tong app, go to My > Feedback, and choose the first option. (2) Select wearable payments. (3) Tap Xiaomi. (4) Copy your confirmation number."

Доступ к камере (для установки фото профиля)

Если вы не предоставите такие разрешения, вы не сможете использовать некоторые функции этого приложения, однако его базовая функциональность будет по-прежнему доступна. Вы всегда можете ограничить разрешения или отозвать свое разрешение в Настройках."

"If you continue, you'll withdraw your consent to our Privacy Policy. The account currently signed in on your paired device will be removed. To delete your data stored in Mi Fitness, delete your Mi Fitness service. To delete data on your paired device, refer to Withdrawal of consent in our Privacy Policy. If you're using a wearable device, a factory reset erases all your data on it. If you change your mind, you won't be able to recover your data. You'll need to agree to our Privacy Policy again and pair your device if you decide you use it."
